intro: Acourtia lepidopoda, commonly known as the silverleaf acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, silver-gray leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and it produces achenes as its seed type. Acourtia lepidopoda is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
